item.title: A Minecraft Movie releases digitally next week
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/a-minecraft-movie-releases-digitally-next-week

Following its record-breaking and rather chaotic run at the cinema, Warner Bros has announced a streaming release date for A Minecraft Movie.

The Jack Black and Jason Momoa-fronted adaptation will be available digitally across the likes of Amazon Prime, Apple TV and Fandango at Home from 13th May. That's this coming Tuesday, if you want to get your Chicken Jockey warm-ups started.

For those more fond of DVDs and Blu-ray discs, A Minecraft Movie will be available to purchase in physical form from 24th June.

As per a press release shared by When to Stream, the A Minecraft Movie Digital, 4K UHD and Blu-ray will include the following special features:

  • Building the World of Minecraft: Block Party - featurette: Grant Major's team brings Minecraft's Overworld to life with blocky textures, vibrant biomes, and square props. Through practical effects and digital art, they craft a cinematic Minecraft world!

  • Creepers, Zombies, and Endermen Oh My! - featurette: Explore the unique mobs in A Minecraft Movie, including Creepers, Piglins, and Zombies. The featurette features live action looks and onscreen performances, with expert designers and artists contributing.

  • A Minecraft Movie: Block Beats - featurette: Music brings A Minecraft Movie to life! Jack Black, Jason Momoa, and Danielle Brooks created fun tunes like "I Feel Alive." Fans will love behind-the-scenes clips and insights into the film's music.

  • A Minecraft Movie: Pixel Pals - featurette: Jack Black and Jason Momoa pour boundless energy into A Minecraft Movie, from Jack's gaming breaks to Jason's wardrobe design. Their chemistry and behind-the-scenes fun bring joy to this film!

  • Marlene + Nitwit - featurette: Marlene and Nitwit's quirky bond shines in this film! In this piece Nitwit, voiced by Matt Berry, narrates their wild journey, parodying My Name is Earl, with hilarious moments from Jennifer Coolidge.

A Minecraft Movie debuted last month, generating $301m worldwide on its first weekend. It has been such a success that there are already talks about a sequel, and director Jared Hess has teased where the film series could go next.

"Lovely performances elevate a movie that captures Minecraft's many bits and pieces but not its creative spirit," Christian Donlan wrote in Eurogamer's A Minecraft Movie review.

In other Minecraft movie news, an unfinished version of the film with effects that actually look closer to the original Minecraft game leaked online following its cinema debut.

item.title: After Star Wars, Fortnite fans expect another themed mini-season this year - potentially involving The Simpsons
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/after-star-wars-fortnite-fans-expect-another-themed-mini-season-this-year-potentially-involving-the-simpsons

Fortnite is currently in the midst of its dedicated Star Wars mini-season, Galactic Battle, but fans are already looking to the future.

Epic Games' battle royale/metaverse has hosted themed seasons before, but only around Marvel. Now, the shorter length and naming of Fortnite's big Star Wars crossover has fans expecting other similar mini-seasons in future.

Officially, Galactic Battle is referred to in-game as Chapter 6: MS1, or Mini-Season 1, something which rather suggests there will be a Mini-Season 2 as well. And indeed, growing whispers suggest another Disney-owned property is being lined up for a crossover later this year: The Simpsons.

Fortnite has long had a close partnership with Disney, and the two companies have only grown closer since the latter's $1.5bn investment to help fund an upcoming Disney mode.

Following the launch of other Disney-owned characters in Fortnite, including those from Disney's own animated films, Pixar movies and Family Guy, The Simpsons' arrival in Fortnite has only seemed like a matter of time.

Now, a cluster of smaller Fortnite leakers have cautiously pointed to a potential Simpsons mini-season later this year, based on access to leaked game information that correctly detailed Fortnite's Star Wars season before it was revealed.

While this is far from a confirmation, it isn't the first time word of a Simpsons crossover has been touted - having originally been noted by another Fortnite leaker as in development late last year.

Last night's leak also reveals other potential details of Fortnite's future content roadmap, and comes almost exactly a year on from the game's 2024 content schedule being leaked in its entirety ahead of time. Eurogamer has contacted Epic Games for more.
